Legal_Issue: Did the immigration officer err in refusing the applicant's permanent residence application based on her qualifications as a librarian?
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant lacked formal library science degree and recent work experience as a librarian; oral explanations considered but insufficient
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate error or unfairness
Credibility_Factor: Officer assessed applicant's qualifications and explanations, found unconvincing under Canadian standards
Legal_Rule: Applicants must meet selection standards for successful establishment in Canada, including specific vocational preparation and experience
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged error in assessment of qualifications and procedural unfairness
Outcome_on_Merits: Officer did not err in applying regulations or breach procedural fairness
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach found; applicant had opportunity to present case
Key_Evidence_Considered: Lack of formal library science degree, no librarian work since 1980, oral explanations provided
Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration law and administrative law principles
Applicant_Challenge: Refusal of permanent residence application due to lack of qualifications
Defendant_Response: Officer applied regulations correctly and maintained procedural fairness
Legal_Provision: Sections of the Immigration Act and Regulations relating to skilled worker qualifications
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration Act and Regulations â€“ Selection criteria for skilled workers
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet vocational qualifications for librarian under Canadian standards
Applicable_Process: Permanent residence application assessment and judicial review
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Applicant may reapply with additional evidence
Governing_Rule: Selection standards for successful establishment in Canada requiring formal qualifications and recent experience
